New Records: Record 1: First walk-off grand slam in World Series history
Key Match Events: Freddie Freeman hit a walk-off grand slam in the bottom of the 10th inning
Giancarlo Stanton hit a two-run home run in the 10th inning
Joe Davis and John Smoltz called the game for FOX
Anthony Volpe drove in the go-ahead run for Yankees in the 10th inning
Shohei Ohtani scored on a sacrifice fly by Mookie Betts in the 9th inning
Freddie Freeman legged out a triple on a misplay in left field by Alex Verdugo in the 1st inning
Pre-Game Insights: Gerrit Cole expressed his dream of playing for the Yankees and facing the Dodgers in the World Series
Aaron Judge mentioned he was ready for this moment and his teammates expressed their belief in their captain
David Ortiz, Derek Jeter, and Alex Rodriguez discussed the pressure on the Yankees and the historical significance of the matchup
The game honored Fernando Valenzuela with memorials and tributes
This is the first World Series featuring five MVPs: Shohei Ohtani, Freddie Freeman, Mookie Betts, Aaron Judge, and Giancarlo Stanton
Post-Match Reflections: Aaron Judge expressed pride in the team's resilience after the comeback win
Dodgers fans commemorated the late Fernando Valenzuela ahead of the game
Miscellaneous Highlights: Weather or field conditions did not affect the match significantly
This was the 12th World Series showdown between the Dodgers and Yankees, but the first in 43 years
The game was the first World Series with a pair of 50-home run hitters in Judge (58) and Ohtani (54)
